subject: French Open (Tennis)
Tennis
lead_paragraph: There were 37 men in the starting singles draw at the French Open who are age 30 or older, an open-era record. The “trentenaires,” as the French call them, were winning all over the grounds at Roland Garros on Tuesday.
snippet: There were 37 men in the starting singles draw at the French Open who are age 30 or older, an open-era record. The “trentenaires,” as the French call them, were winning all over the grounds at Roland Garros on Tuesday.
